job_title: Director of Admissions in Rochester Hills, MI
pros: Great people, great students! Very much a family atmosphere, and the ability to move up. Everyone knows who you are.
cons: Private college, so pay scale is below what most people expect in a union area.

pros: shape future generations.  If you don't live too far away.  If you are allowed to go, chapel is great.  many employees are fantastic.
cons:
poor management, "good old boy network", poor pay, surprisingly not family friendly (for a Christian college)
Things said in the interview are substantially different than reality.  Very little training or direction in the job.  no budget to work with and a 20 million dollar deficit.

review_title: It is like a family...a dysfunctional family
job_title: Development Department in Rochester Hills, MI
pros: It is great to feel like you are shaping the minds of future generations
cons: Compensation is LOW. Morale suffers. Very weak leadership.  HR is often unaware of what is said/promised in the interview process.

pros: Rochester College offers their professors flexible scheduling and a strong sense of purpose and community.
cons: Tuition-driven institution. Resources are often tight.
